title: Awesome List Updates on Jun 16, 2023
_seo_title: Awesome List Updates on Jun 16, 2023 - Track Awesome List

items.title: Discount for Student Dev
items.content_text:
### Software Packs

*   [Github Student Developer Pack](https://education.github.com/pack/) \[FREE] - The GitHub Student Developer Pack is a collection of tools and resources that are available to students for free. It includes access to various developer tools, cloud services, and learning resources.
items.content_html:
Software Packs

  • Github Student Developer Pack [FREE] - The GitHub Student Developer Pack is a collection of tools and resources that are available to students for free. It includes access to various developer tools, cloud services, and learning resources.

items.title: Awesome Selfhosted
items.content_text:

items.content_html:

items.title: Awesome Openstreetmap
items.content_text:
### Maps / Map Games

*   [PraxisMapper (‚≠ê61)](https://github.com/drakewill-CRL/PraxisMapper) - GPS Game server, for making mobile games around exploring the real world.
*   [Arnis (‚≠ê7.5k)](https://github.com/louis-e/arnis) - Generate cities from real life in Minecraft using Python.
items.content_html:
Maps / Map Games

  • PraxisMapper (‚≠ê61) - GPS Game server, for making mobile games around exploring the real world.
  • Arnis (‚≠ê7.5k) - Generate cities from real life in Minecraft using Python.

items.title: Awesome Langchain
items.content_text:
### Open Source Projects / Other / Chatbots

*   [QNimGPT](https://huggingface.co/spaces/rituthombre/QNim): Play Nim against an IBM Quantum Computer simulator or OpenAI GPT-3.5
*   [CSV-AI üß†](https://python.langchain.com/en/latest/modules/indexes/document_loaders/examples/snowflake.html): CSV-AI is the ultimate app powered by LangChain that allows you to unlock hidden insights in your CSV files.
*   [MindGeniusAI (‚≠ê249)](https://github.com/xianjianlf2/MindGeniusAI): Auto generate MindMap with ChatGPT ![GitHub Repo stars](https://img.shields.io/github/stars/xianjianlf2/MindGeniusAI?style=social)
items.content_html:
Open Source Projects / Other / Chatbots

  • QNimGPT: Play Nim against an IBM Quantum Computer simulator or OpenAI GPT-3.5
  • CSV-AI üß†: CSV-AI is the ultimate app powered by LangChain that allows you to unlock hidden insights in your CSV files.
  • MindGeniusAI (‚≠ê249): Auto generate MindMap with ChatGPT

items.title: Awesome Cl
items.content_text:
### Natural Language Processing

*   [CLM](https://ccrma.stanford.edu/software/clm/) - Common Lisp Music is a music synthesis and signal processing package in the Music V family. It provides much the same functionality as Stk, Csound, SuperCollider, PD, CMix, cmusic, and Arctic ‚Äî a collection of functions that create and manipulate sounds, aimed primarily at composers (in CLM's case anyway).
    *   [common-tones (‚≠ê12)](https://github.com/theraphonics/common-tones) - a fork of CLM5 with modern Lisp (ASDF, cffi‚Ä¶). [BSD\_3Clause](https://directory.fsf.org/wiki/License:BSD_3Clause).

### C, C++

*   [cl-frugal-uuid (‚≠ê29)](https://github.com/ak-coram/cl-frugal-uuid/) -  Common Lisp UUID library with zero dependencies. [MIT](https://opensource.org/licenses/MIT).

### Other DB wrappers

*   [cl-duckdb (‚≠ê44)](https://github.com/ak-coram/cl-duckdb) -  Common Lisp CFFI wrapper around the DuckDB C API. [MIT](https://opensource.org/licenses/MIT).

### YAML

*   [archlinux-cl (‚≠ê5)](https://github.com/yitzchak/archlinux-cl) - Docker Arch Linux image with Common Lisp implementations (7 to this day). MIT.

### C

*   ‚≠ê [CFFI (‚≠ê458)](https://github.com/cffi/cffi) - Portable, easy-to-use C foreign function interface. [Expat](https://directory.fsf.org/wiki/License:Expat).
    *   [cffi-ops (‚≠ê48)](https://github.com/bohonghuang/cffi-ops) - helps write concise CFFI-related code.
    *   [cffi-objects (‚≠ê28)](https://github.com/bohonghuang/cffi-object) - enables fast and convenient interoperation with foreign objects.

### Miscellaneous

*   [CEDAR](https://gitlab.com/sasanidas/cedar) - an advance interactive development environment aiming to be Emacs compatible with all the features that come with it. (WIP)

### Reactive programming

*   [lwcells (‚≠ê19)](https://github.com/kchanqvq/lwcells) - Light Weight Cells.
    *   LWCELLS is a dataflow extension to Common Lisp. It maintains a consistent state of cells according to functions specifying their relation. LWCELLS is designed to be simple, clean, compositional and flexible.

### Shells, shells interfaces / Third-party APIs

*   [unix-in-lisp (‚≠ê162)](https://github.com/PuellaeMagicae/unix-in-lisp) -  Mount Unix system into Common Lisp image.
    *   Unix concepts are directly/shallowly embedded into Lisp (Unix commands become Lisp macros, Unix file become Lisp variables, Unix streams become lazy Lisp sequences, etc).
items.content_html:
Natural Language Processing

  • CLM - Common Lisp Music is a music synthesis and signal processing package in the Music V family. It provides much the same functionality as Stk, Csound, SuperCollider, PD, CMix, cmusic, and Arctic ‚Äî a collection of functions that create and manipulate sounds, aimed primarily at composers (in CLM's case anyway).
    • common-tones (‚≠ê12) - a fork of CLM5 with modern Lisp (ASDF, cffi‚Ä¶). BSD_3Clause.

C, C++

  • cl-frugal-uuid (‚≠ê29) - Common Lisp UUID library with zero dependencies. MIT.

Other DB wrappers

  • cl-duckdb (‚≠ê44) - Common Lisp CFFI wrapper around the DuckDB C API. MIT.

YAML

  • archlinux-cl (‚≠ê5) - Docker Arch Linux image with Common Lisp implementations (7 to this day). MIT.

C

  • ‚≠ê CFFI (‚≠ê458) - Portable, easy-to-use C foreign function interface. Expat.
    • cffi-ops (‚≠ê48) - helps write concise CFFI-related code.
    • cffi-objects (‚≠ê28) - enables fast and convenient interoperation with foreign objects.

Miscellaneous

  • CEDAR - an advance interactive development environment aiming to be Emacs compatible with all the features that come with it. (WIP)

Reactive programming

  • lwcells (‚≠ê19) - Light Weight Cells.
    • LWCELLS is a dataflow extension to Common Lisp. It maintains a consistent state of cells according to functions specifying their relation. LWCELLS is designed to be simple, clean, compositional and flexible.

Shells, shells interfaces / Third-party APIs

  • unix-in-lisp (‚≠ê162) - Mount Unix system into Common Lisp image.
    • Unix concepts are directly/shallowly embedded into Lisp (Unix commands become Lisp macros, Unix file become Lisp variables, Unix streams become lazy Lisp sequences, etc).

items.title: Awesome Engineering Team Management
items.content_text:
### Project Management / Estimations

*   [Software effort estimation is mostly fake research](https://shape-of-code.com/2021/01/17/software-effort-estimation-is-mostly-fake-research/) - ‚ÄúThe NASA dataset contains 93 rows (that is not a typo, there is no power-of-ten missing), COCOMO 63 rows, Desharnais 81 rows, and (‚Ä¶) the China dataset contains 499 rows.‚Äù

### Communication / Writing

*   [Ten simple rules for structuring papers](https://www.biorxiv.org/content/10.1101/088278v5.full.pdf) - ‚ÄúFocusing on how readers consume information, we present a set of 10 simple rules to help you get across the main idea of your paper.‚Äù
items.content_html:
Project Management / Estimations

  • Software effort estimation is mostly fake research - ‚ÄúThe NASA dataset contains 93 rows (that is not a typo, there is no power-of-ten missing), COCOMO 63 rows, Desharnais 81 rows, and (‚Ä¶) the China dataset contains 499 rows.‚Äù

Communication / Writing

  • Ten simple rules for structuring papers - ‚ÄúFocusing on how readers consume information, we present a set of 10 simple rules to help you get across the main idea of your paper.‚Äù

items.title: Awesome Polars
items.content_text:
### Blog posts / Miscellaneous

*   [Polars vs Pandas: A Brief Tale of Two DataFrame Libraries](https://dev.to/ranggakd/polars-vs-pandas-a-brief-tale-of-two-dataframe-libraries-lli) - A blog post that compares Polars and Pandas focusing in particular on optional dependencies by [@ranggakd](https://github.com/ranggakd).
items.content_html:
Blog posts / Miscellaneous

  • Polars vs Pandas: A Brief Tale of Two DataFrame Libraries - A blog post that compares Polars and Pandas focusing in particular on optional dependencies by @ranggakd.

items.title: Awesome Billing
items.content_text:
### Contracts / Currencies

*   [Entitlements untangled: The modern way to software monetization](https://www.stigg.io/blog-posts/entitlements-untangled-the-modern-way-to-software-monetization) - ‚ÄúThe concept of Entitlements encapsulates the feature access settings under various product variants (aka Pricing Plans or Packages), bridging the gap between how a product is sold and how it behaves for a variant. In essence, entitlements are a set of permissions defining what a customer (paying or non-paying) can do with your software application.‚Äù
*   [Quantity discounts on a virtual good: The results of a massive pricing experiment](https://sci-hub.st/https://www.pnas.org/doi/pdf/10.1073/pnas.1510501113) - ‚ÄúImplementing price reductions ranging from 9‚Äì70% for large purchases, we found remarkably little impact on revenue, either positively or negatively.‚Äù If discounts are a placebo and are still widely used in the industry, maybe they are a marketing hack to lure big customers?
*   ‚ÄúIt used to be I could just give a lump sum and let Google Ads play until there is no more budget. Not anymore.‚Äù - ([source](https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=36325785)) - Google Ads used to implement a concept of capped actuals. A kind of monthly budget with rollover, which is an optimal billing scheme to limit surprises for customers. It always looked to me as a way to sell quotas.

### Invoice / Electronic invoices

*   [GOBL](https://gobl.org) - JSON Schema, Open Source Go library, global tax database, with conversion tools, all in one.
items.content_html:
Contracts / Currencies

  • Entitlements untangled: The modern way to software monetization - ‚ÄúThe concept of Entitlements encapsulates the feature access settings under various product variants (aka Pricing Plans or Packages), bridging the gap between how a product is sold and how it behaves for a variant. In essence, entitlements are a set of permissions defining what a customer (paying or non-paying) can do with your software application.‚Äù
  • Quantity discounts on a virtual good: The results of a massive pricing experiment - ‚ÄúImplementing price reductions ranging from 9‚Äì70% for large purchases, we found remarkably little impact on revenue, either positively or negatively.‚Äù If discounts are a placebo and are still widely used in the industry, maybe they are a marketing hack to lure big customers?
  • ‚ÄúIt used to be I could just give a lump sum and let Google Ads play until there is no more budget. Not anymore.‚Äù - (source) - Google Ads used to implement a concept of capped actuals. A kind of monthly budget with rollover, which is an optimal billing scheme to limit surprises for customers. It always looked to me as a way to sell quotas.

Invoice / Electronic invoices

  • GOBL - JSON Schema, Open Source Go library, global tax database, with conversion tools, all in one.
